article.paragraph: Carolyn Ann Mayer-Beug(December 11, 1952 September 11, 2001) was afilmmakerand video producer fromSanta Monica, CaliforniaSanta Monica,California. She died in theSeptember 11 attacks.
article.heading: Career
article.paragraph: In addition to her work as video producer, Beug also directed three music videos for country singerDwight Yoakam: "Ain't That Lonely Yet", "A Thousand Miles from Nowhere" and "Fast as You." Beug co-directed the former two videos with Yoakam and was the sole director of the latter video. She won an award for theVan Halenmusic videoof the song "Right Now (Van Halen song)Right Now", which she produced.
article.heading: Personal life
article.paragraph: Beug lived in aTudor-stylehome in the North 25th Street neighborhood. She hosted an annual backyard barbecue for theSanta Monica High Schoolcross country and track team, which her daughters captained. Beug was aLatter Day Saint.citation neededOctober 2011
article.heading: Death and legacy
article.paragraph: Beug was killed at the age of 48 in the crash ofAmerican Airlines Flight 11in theSeptember 11, 2001 attacks. At the time of her death, Carolyn Beug was working on a children's book aboutNoah's Arkwhich was to be told from Noah's wife's point of view. On the plane with her was her mother, Mary Alice Wahlstrom. Beug was survived by her twin eighteen-year-old daughters Lauren and Lindsey Mayer-Beug, her 13-year-old son, Nick, and her husband, John Beug, a senior vice president in charge of filmed production for Warner Brothers' record division. She was returning home from taking her daughters to college at theRhode Island School of Design.citation neededOctober 2011
At theNational 9/11 Memorial, Beug is memorialized at the North Pool, on Panel N-1.Carolyn Mayer Beug. Memorial Guide:National 9/11 Memorial. Retrieved December 11, 2011.
